intro: Adenopetalum irasuense, commonly known as the Irasu bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy areas and has a compact, herbaceous habit. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Adenopetalum irasuense is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
